FoilWinding

class pyrit.toolbox.geolibrary.FoilWinding(name: str = '', origin_x: float = 0, origin_y: float = 0, origin_z: float = 0, anchor: Union[BasicAnchor, Tuple[float]] = BasicAnchor.SOUTH_WEST, height: float = 1.0, turns: int = 10, angle: float = 0, foil_insulation_distribution: float = 0.5, mesh_size: float = 0.1, foil_thickness: float = 0.1, insulation_thickness: float = 0.01, fill_factor: Optional[float] = None, width: Optional[float] = None)

Bases: Geo

Model of foil windings in a 2D geometry.

There are optional paramters. Most of them are self-explanatory. The others are explained here:

  • anchor

    This is the position of the foil winding that lies on the origin coordinates. It can be a predefined Anchor (Anchor) or a tuple of two numbers. (0,0) is the south-west corner (1,1) is the north-east corner.

  • foil_insulation_distribution

    Determines how the cinductor and insulator of a foil are arranged. This is a number in \((0,1)\), where 0 means that the conductor is as much left as possible and 1 means that it is as much richt as possible. The value of 0.5 for exapmle means that on each side of the conductor, there is an insulation layer of the same thickness.

Note that the layout of the windings can be determined either by foil_thickness and insulation_thickness (default) or fill_factor and width. After creation, the other values will be set appropriately.

Examples

The easiest way to create this model is by

>>> model = FoilWinding('foil_winding')

This can then be used with the geometry module

>>> from pyrit.geometry.Geometry import Geometry
>>> geo = Geometry('foil_winding', show_gui=True)
>>> with geo.geometry():
>>>     model.add_to_gmsh()

Constructor

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the Geo

  • origin_x (float, optional) – The x-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_y (float, optional) – The y-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

  • origin_z (float, optional) – The z-coordinate of the origin. Default 0

Computes the coordinates of an anchor.

Parameters

add_to_gmsh(**kwargs)

Adds the Entities of the Geo to gmsh.

When this method is called, gmsh needs to be initialized. So at least

gmsh.initialize(sys.argv)

has to be called beforehand. However, it is recommended to use the context manager Geometry from the class Geometry.

property points: List[List[Point]]

Returns all Points of the model.

Returns

out – The first entry is a list of the bottom points and the second entry a list ot the top points.

Return type

List[List[Point]]

property lines: List[List[Line]]

Returns all lines of the model.

Returns

out – The first entry is a list of the bottom lines, the second entry of the top lines and the third entry of the vertical lines.

Return type

List[List[Line]]

property outer_lines: List[Line]

A list of all outer lines.

This list can be used for the definition of another surface around the foil winding.

Returns
